name: Heart of England Rover (3 in 7 or 7 days)
description:
HEART OF ENGLAND ROVER Unlimited travel with weekday time restrictions for either any 3 days in 7 days or 7 consecutive days. Centered around Birmingham it extends from Chester and Matlock in the north to Gloucester and Oxford in the south and from Hereford and Shrewsbury 
      in the west to Nottingham, Leicester and Northampton in the east and encompasses Birmingham, Crewe, Stoke-on-Trent, Worcester and Derby.

fares_and_restrictions.raw: fares & restrictions New fares from 2nd Mar 2025 Any 3 days in 7 adult: £114.00 child (5-15): £75.90 16-17 saver: £75.90 railcards ⯆ 16 26 SE DI 2T H V : £75.90 H V child fare: £21.65 7 consecutive days adult: £150.00 child (5-15): £99.90 16-17 saver: £99.90 railcards ⯆ 16 26 SE DI 2T H V : £99.90 H V child fare: £28.50 Railcards ⯈ Railcards: 16 = 16-25 26 = 26-30 SE = Senior DI = Disabled 2T = Two Together H = HM Forces V = Veterans Previous fares ⯈ Previous fares (adult) 3 in 7 days: 2024 - £109.00 2023 - £104.00 2022 - £98.00 2021 - £91.50 2020 - £91.50 2019 - £89.00 2018 - £86.20 2014 - £77.00 2011 - £67.20 7 days: 2024 - £143.00 2023 - £136.00 2022 - £128.00 2021 - £120.00 2020 - £120.00 2019 - £116.00 2018 - £112.00 2014 - £100.00 2011 - £87.40 time restrictions Mon to Fri: valid from 09:00 but 2T railcard not valid until 09:30 No restrictions at weekends or bank holidays train operating companies Avanti West Coast, Chiltern Railways, CrossCountry, East Midlands Railway, Great Western Railway, London Northwestern Railway, Northern, Transport for Wales, West Midlands Railway purchasing Online: X Train conductor: ✔ * Station ticket office: ✔ Ticket Vending Machine: i Northern Ticket Vending Machines now sell most ranger and rover tickets but at the moment only for same-day travel (rather prohibitive for distant areas) Some Avanti West Coast station TVMs for example Crewe, now sell local rangers and rovers. LNER TVMs at Doncaster, Edinburgh, London King's Cross, Newcastle and York also sell them. A number of PTE areas sell local rangers from TVMs in their area e.g. South Yorkshire, Strathclyde and West Midlands * valid ticket to travel is required unless boarded at a station without ticket-issuing facilities
